comment: This is not the setting to be talking about the ocean. A rigorous multifactor analysis is the only appropriate setting for an educator to discuss a complicated topic with his students. Simple classroom equations just don't cut it. I get the point, but drop the inferences and forecasting in the future, please. I'm here for knowledge, not activism.
Дякую за те, що ділитеся такими відео. Вони дуже допомагають у зрозумінні таких важливих тем.

If you're just looking for the part of the lecture where he discusses acids and bases go to around 29:30. The section before it is helpful though since he ties everything back to a real world example.

41:42 There s something wrong in comparing Ka >> 1 These are not the same unit What should be instead compared is Ka with the initial concentration of HCl However as the concentration of acid used are often in the order of magnitude of 1, his statement is still valid
great lecture! 19:12   x = 1,7 x 10 exp-9  how do we get that result?  I thought it's rather the  [Ag+] at equilibrium, after the addtion of the NaCl, that became 1.7x10exp-9..     is it not so?
i salute you dr Grossman...you are a wonderfull teacher with talent to deliver education...
If you’re just looking for the part of the lecture where he throws the t-shirts, go to 46:45. The section before is very helpful since he presents the whole lecture.
